title: Highest Real Interest Rate
description: In 2023, Madagascar recorded a real interest rate of 41.30%, one of the highest globally, indicating a significant cost of borrowing.

title: Highest Risk Premium on Lending
description: The risk premium on lending in Madagascar reached 43.86% in 2023, highlighting the elevated risk perceived by lenders.

title: Lowest Operational Efficiency in Utility Services
description: In 2024, Madagascar scored 22.38 in operational efficiency of utility services, indicating challenges in service provision.

title: Significant Value Lost Due to Electrical Outages
description: In 2022, firms in Madagascar lost 24% of sales due to electrical outages, reflecting infrastructure challenges.

title: Shortest Compulsory Education Duration
description: Madagascar mandates only 5 years of compulsory education as of 2023, one of the shortest durations worldwide.

title: Low Female Persistence to Grade 5
description: Only 33.26% of female students persisted to grade 5 in 2018, indicating challenges in female education retention.

title: High Rate of Primary School Repeaters
description: In 2018, 26.07% of students repeated primary school, highlighting issues in educational progression.

title: Few Trained Male Teachers in Primary Education
description: Only 11.16% of male primary teachers were trained in 2019, indicating a gap in teacher qualification.

title: Minimal Government Expenditure on Tertiary Education
description: In 2016, government expenditure per student in tertiary education was only 0.038% of GDP per capita, one of the lowest globally.

title: Low Urban Access to Basic Sanitation Services
description: As of 2022, only 21.64% of the urban population had access to basic sanitation services, reflecting public health challenges.

title: High Female Labor Force Participation Rate
description: In 2024, 82.56% of females aged 15+ were part of the labor force, showcasing strong female workforce engagement.
